text: release script ensure_clean() now filters '??' untracked lines from git status --porcelain — only tracked changes (no '??' prefix) block a release. Previously any output (including untracked .kg/ files) caused a false-dirty block. [[kg-architecture]]
.kg/ runtime files (.kg/.claude/ symlink, .kg/nodes/ fleeting notes) are untracked by git and will appear in git status --porcelain output — add to .gitignore or use a filter that skips '??' lines

Click CLI: add no_args_is_help=True to any @click.command() that has required arguments — shows full help (docstring + options) instead of the terse 'Missing argument X / Try --help' error when invoked bare. Applied to kg add, kg show, kg create, kg update, kg delete, kg run, kg mux send, kg launcher agent pause/resume/drain/migrate, kg agent create/delete.

Install kg from local source as a uv tool (dev version): 'uv tool install --editable /path/to/kg' — changes to source are reflected immediately without reinstalling. To revert to published version: 'uv tool install kg --reinstall'. Check with 'uv tool list'.
.kg/.gitignore should cover: index/, logs/, messages/, sessions/
uv tool install --editable /path/to/pkg installs dev version as uv tool; changes to source reflected immediately without reinstall

uv tool install --editable: changes in source are reflected immediately BUT running background processes (mux, launcher) loaded old code at start time. Must restart processes after code changes. Always restart via the same kg binary that started them.
after creating new KG nodes (e.g. agent nodes written directly as node.jsonl files), run kg reindex to add them to the SQLite FTS database — otherwise web UI slugs won't resolve and node pages 404
gotcha: system-installed kg (~/.local/share/uv/tools/kg/) and dev .venv/bin/kg can have schema mismatches — watcher using old binary will fail silently with 'SQL logic error' when DB schema changed
fix schema mismatch: run .venv/bin/kg reindex to rebuild graph.db from scratch using dev schema, then .venv/bin/kg start to restart watcher with dev version
